column1: Make. It. Easier. To. Vote.   https://t.co/wUoUNgmIs6

Proud to receive an “A” rating from @StopBigMoney Action Fund in their first legislative scorecard. From day one of my first campaign I have refused to accept any PAC money because I’m here to represent you - not special interests. https://t.co/mqWkH7baGl

Our first Brewery Tour stop of 2020 will be on Saturday January 25th from 3:30-5:00pm at @WestbrookBeer in Mount Pleasant. Come out and show your support for our 2020 re-election campaign! #LowcountryOverParty  Details and RSVP: https://t.co/YPDB0xhXE0 https://t.co/fBCVYtMoMq

A year ago today I made a rookie mistake and tried to deliver some of our world famous Lowcountry craft beer to a colleague on the House floor. Still haven't gotten that rule changed 😂  Speaking of which I'll be dropping some news later today 🍻  https://t.co/lzIGgt8CwO
Happy Birthday to an American hero. https://t.co/VuQEQdhLH2

Big 🏈 game on Mon night between @ClemsonFB and @LSUfootball and Rep. @garretgraves of Louisiana and I have a little wager on the game. *When* Clemson beats LSU Rep Graves has to wear a Clemson jersey around the Capitol the next day. If LSU wins I’ll wear an LSU jersey. #AllIn

Since being elected to Congress I’ve made it a point to be accessible to my constituents by holding frequent town hall meetings in #SC01 so I can hear directly from you. On Saturday I’m having another one in Charleston and I hope you can come. https://t.co/E7D5onmg2I
I am closely monitoring the events in Iraq tonight. In the meantime please join me in saying a prayer for our troops and their families. 🇺🇸
Go Dogs 🏆🏆 https://t.co/gdnOhDtpYj
Congratulations to a great reporter. https://t.co/FyxZ810aNb
Great picture @harrisonjaime. He is indeed missed. Happy 98th Birthday Senator Hollings! https://t.co/2vzAUZQfPW

Lowcountry infrastructure plays an essential role in maintaining a strong economy and keeping our residents safe. That's why I helped secure federal funding for projects like the proposed Ashley River bridge and to tackle flooding in the Charleston medical district. https://t.co/rk8XHCoJvy

The Hill just named our 2018 campaign “one of the biggest upsets of the decade.” Now some are predicting my 2020 re-election to be the most competitive race in the country. We will win in 2020 but I need ur help. Send $25 to let me know you’re on the team. https://t.co/cPKKC18Xi8

I pledged to end corruption in Washington and make our elections more fair. That’s why I helped pass HR 1 which would put an end to partisan gerrymandering and take dark money out of politics.   Voters should choose their politicians not the other way around. https://t.co/EPYBbbk7w0
I see what you did there. https://t.co/X62rAvbpeq

One of the best parts about serving in Congress is getting to work alongside @repjohnlewis. He’s a hero to so many Americans myself included. Amanda and I are lifting Congressman Lewis up in prayer tonight and sending him his family and his staff lots of love. https://t.co/r8fEoqkGvn

Supporting our Lowcountry military installations and national defense has been a top priority of mine in Congress. That is why I have worked hard to ensure military bases do not fall victim to another round of BRAC a program that has shut down dozens of bases in the past. https://t.co/pacla10sPz

As a candidate I pledged to protect our coast from dangerous offshore drilling. As a member of Congress I delivered on that promise. This year the House passed my bipartisan bill to permanently ban offshore drilling. Our Lowcountry economy thrives when we protect our coastline https://t.co/VFOPGTvkf1
I like my beer ice cold. 🐅 https://t.co/zXJ9INFjAn
Great. You’re gonna love @WestbrookBeer (and Trevor Lawrence’s arm). https://t.co/zXJ9INFjAn

Jump Little Children - Cathedrals - Live from the Charleston Music Hall https://t.co/glcP8Dq6gQ

As my first year in Congress comes to a close I wanted to share with you just some of the work we’ve gotten done for folks in the Lowcountry. It is truly the honor of my life to represent you every day in Washington. #LowcountryOverParty #SC01 #scpol   https://t.co/nYwF1VCDNk

The most common issue Lowcountry residents bring up to me is the crushing cost of healthcare and prescription drugs. I have helped pass eight bills out of the House that lower these costs and expand access. A price tag should never be a barrier to accessing quality care. https://t.co/hzVE2RbrSU
Merry Christmas! #NailedIt https://t.co/uegDONeA4N

No person should be discriminated against on the basis of gender sexual orientation or gender identity. That’s why I co-sponsored and helped pass the Equality Act because everyone deserves equal treatment under the law no matter who they are or who they love. https://t.co/RQ3h8vpqJb

I was elected to serve you not myself. And I certainly wasn’t elected to give myself a raise. That's why I bucked both parties by helping to kill a proposed pay hike for Congress this year. Its time to balance our budget and tackle our $23 trillion nat’l debt not raise our pay. https://t.co/Dg8fkwHKcj

Excited to launch our new campaign store! It includes traditional campaign gear plus our brand new 2020 Brewery Tour merchandise. Grab some campaign swag before we ring in 2020. All proceeds go to our re-election campaign. Happy Holidays! https://t.co/TwzxdMKr4g
@SpanbergerVA07 @UVAHoops @SpiderMBB @VCU_Hoops Touché!

As a member of the Veterans' Affairs Committee I’m proud to report that several of my bills to help our veterans have passed the House in 2019:  ✔️VA Tele-Hearing Modernization Act ✔️Women Veterans Healthcare Accountability Act ✔️Blue Water Navy Veterans Act (signed into law ✅) https://t.co/eECs9SJLwt

After the Emanuel AME shooting I said enough is enough. Together with @WhipClyburn and SC grassroots leaders we passed a bill this year to finally close the Charleston Loophole. As a gun owner and father I’m committed to protecting our communities AND the 2nd Amendment. https://t.co/GuiESEuq3t

#LowcountryOverParty wasn’t just a slogan it was a promise. Over 90% of the bills I cosponsored have support from both parties and I’m proud to be ranked the most bipartisan freshman in my caucus. I’ll continue that independent streak to deliver common sense solutions for #SC01. https://t.co/v6G1NyEuHZ
NYC has never looked this good. Happy 250th @CofC. Go Cougs! https://t.co/1FrDIaF8iy

There’s enough bad politics in Washington D.C. and I will not add to it. My sights have always been set on what is best for the Lowcountry.  That has never wavered. And I can assure you it never will.  https://t.co/vOCHBWtRew

Enjoyed getting to see hometown boys @theJumpHQ perform last night in DC and honor them in the Congressional record. They’re just as good as I remember them 20 yrs ago. Here’s to many more years of success for these incredible ambassadors for Charleston!  https://t.co/Cr9m0tZwlG

DC special interests want me gone bc I won’t play their political games or take their dirty money. They fear members who think for themselves put their districts first and have strong grassroots support.   Help me show them who’s boss - YOU!  DONATE: https://t.co/cPKKC18Xi8 https://t.co/SYHEI1nhKT
Good to see this farmer get some initial justice. This was botched from the very beginning and it’s time for the state to let this man do this job.  https://t.co/xLSILz54hd

Hi @NRCC thx for weighing in. Not sure where you’ve been but I’ve *literally* helped pass 7 bills that lower Rx drug prices got the Blue Water Navy bill signed into law secured an $18 mil grant to build a bridge in Charleston and my offshore drilling ban bill passed in Sept. https://t.co/j4lXk3B3KY

I’m working hard for the Lowcountry - to lower the cost of prescription drugs take care of our vets improve our crumbling infrastructure and of course ban offshore drilling. It’s humbling to know that voters from both parties are with me in this fight. #LowcountryOverParty https://t.co/whkXAYtHO7

Thankful for family friends and the Lowcountry. And especially grateful to the men and women of our Armed Services who aren’t able to spend time with their family today. A Lowcountry legend. In short he was the greatest high school football coach our state has ever seen. A big congrats to Edmund’s Oast Brewing Co. and Revelry Brewing Co. for coming away with medals at GABF last weekend! 🏅 Way to represent the Lowcountry and our amazing local brewery scene.

Yesterday we remembered a national hero Lt. Frank “Skip” Murphy. A Citadel graduate Skip sacrificed his life to save 9 fellow soldiers while in Vietnam. His courage was later recognized when he was awarded the Bronze Star and Purple Heart. Thank you Skip you’re a hero to all.
For my friends observing Yom Kippur may you have an easy and meaningful fast.

Over two years ago I pledged to the people of the Lowcountry that if they elected me to Congress I would fight like hell to ban offshore drilling off our coast.  Today my bipartisan bill to do just that comes up for a vote in the US House of Representatives.  Let’s get it done.

I'm going to be marching in the @CharlestonPride Parade this Sat 9/14 and would love for you to join me! We are meeting at Wragg Square (342 Meeting St) at 8am to decorate the car and get lined up. Email bri@joecunninghamforcongress.com if you are interested in joining us! 🏳️‍🌈 https://t.co/VbNAtfjF0F

It’s a *big* week. Tomorrow the full House will vote on my bill to ban offshore drilling off our coast. So naturally I had to make a new playlist. Enjoy these tunes from Zeppelin Marvin Gaye @TheHighwomen @ToadWetSprocket @ThomasRhett and more. 🎶  https://t.co/Z55UyOqwIo

It’s back! Excited to announce the launch of the 2020 Cunningham Brewery Tour! The kickoff event will be Sat 9/21 from 4-6pm at @Lowtidebrewing on Johns Island. I want to hear ab what’s important to YOU over some tasty local craft beer! 🍺🇺🇸  Details: https://t.co/vScssledDs https://t.co/H0I9kO3woN

Great to see candidates for president supporting a ban on drilling. Folks from both parties understand that offshore drilling is bad for our environment and our economy. Headed to DC this week to pass my bill to ban it for good. Stay tuned! #LowcountryOverParty https://t.co/94CDcmS9sH
Sunday morning family adventure down to Waterfront Park. https://t.co/NfOoNJgrtF

No party is immune to redistricting abuse. Republicans do it in red states Democrats do it in blue states. That’s why both parties must come together to take the politics out of redistricting. Candidates should win on their ideas and merits not bc their party rigged the system.

Overcoming gerrymandering isnt impossible just extremely rare. Our district was rigged for the GOP by 10 pts and it didnt flip for 40 yrs. When we won some called it the biggest upset in SC history. Not bc of the types of campaigns we ran but bc of how the district was drawn.

Fewer general elections favor incumbents you know the folks drawing the lines. And when a district is rigged for one particular party the winner of the primary is usually the most conservative or liberal. That’s why we have very few moderate politicians anymore.

They have the authority to cut deals with other legislators to make their districts “safer” so they are less likely to face a tough general election opponent. This results in very few competitive general elections and more competitive primaries.

Every 10 yrs partisan politicians use the power of redistricting to draw district lines in a way that protects their own political interests. It’s time to take that power away and let independent commissions draw them in a more fair and equitable manner. https://t.co/UGy6NLk6OA
